extendedInfo.description: Command reference including ~570 Linux commands.  Each command includes the name of the command, syntax, description, and command options (if applicable).* Database download error resolved.  Sorry for the inconvenience!Please direct any questions/concerns you have to development@dekrypted-it.com.  Thanks!

reviews.title: Novice but learning fast !
reviews.comment: Should display a short explaination for every command in the database so that I know what a command does without having to click on every command. Example: I want to copy a file but don\'t know the command. I would have to look through the whole database and click on every entity instead of just searching for copy. How could I know cp is the command for copy?  Otherwise excellent app!
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.comment: Wonderful. Allows me to keep a pocket reference of commands when working with my Linux desktop. Also useful for rooted phones.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.comment: Works great! Must have for any linux user! Examples for each command would give 5 stars.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: The Best
reviews.comment: All the info for beginner and up. Ability to keep favorites as well. No search though.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: trying different lists
reviews.comment: Ok list better if searchable. Even if first letter only.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Very good
reviews.comment: Very very good app to learn linux commands. It would be rated 5 star if it contains the search option..Overall good. Thanks a lot.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Unknown Error
reviews.comment: It seems not supported after I switch to galaxy note 2. Unknown error occurs and cannot download the database.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.comment: Better than other Linux command applications. Would love a \"Linux command of the day\" widget...
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.comment: Perfect, if you don\'t have man pages available, Would like to see a category view, and search based on what you are trying to do
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Excellent app
reviews.comment: a very good with clear description of tge commands, but it just lacks the search option....
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.comment: Handy. Would consider purchasing if it had a search facility and no ads.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Galaxy s3
reviews.comment: So it sounds like it\'ll be a good reference guide but will not work on my galaxy s 3
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: I want ti give it 5 but i can\'t
reviews.comment: It is. Fast smooth. But it needs more commands ,also it would be better if u classified to network, etc...
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.comment: Great app, perfect for a noob like me. Clean, fast, small, nicely done. Droid 2
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.comment: Great reference app but please offer an ad free version.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.comment: great linux commands dictionary, it must be very helping for linux os users. unfortunately, there are no examples...
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Useful but has problems.
reviews.comment: It downloads a nice list of linux commands, however that list is not searchable. The command descriptions often get truncated, apparently at the first comma. This bug is a serious flaw and significantly decreases the app\'s utility.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Good reference app..
reviews.comment: Very handy at times
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Great
reviews.comment: Great app. Very helpful.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: nice reference, but no longer maintained
reviews.comment: I had this on a Vizio tablet and it was a nice way to reference commands.  I upgraded to Nexus 7 and Galaxy Nexus and it crashes on launch on both.  I see the last time it was updated was 2010.
reviews.author: A Google User
